name: D2. Zero-One  Hard Version
statement:
You are given two binary strings a and b, both of length n. You can do
the following operation any number of times (possibly zero). Select two
indices l and r (l < r). Change a_l to (1 - a_l), and a_r to (1 - a_r).
If l + 1 = r, the cost of the operation is x. Otherwise, the cost is y.
You have to find the minimum cost needed to make a equal to b or say
there is no way to do so.
